question:
Which of the following is / are correct statements with respect to Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change?
  1. It is an international body for assessing the science related to climate change.
  2. It was established after the Rio Summit of 1992 which is popularly known as earth summit.
  3. It was awarded Nobel peace prize for its efforts in fight against climate change.
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: The Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) is an intergovernmental body of the United Nations for assessing the science related to climate change. The IPCC was set up in 1988 by the World Meteorological Organization (WMO) and United Nations Environment Programme (UNEP). It was awarded Nobel peace prize in 2007 for its efforts to build up and disseminate greater knowledge about man-made climate change, and to lay the foundations for the measures that are needed to counteract such change. IPCC shared the Nobel peace prize with Former U.S. Vice-President Al Gore. Hence only statements 1 and 3 are correct.
